post.title: Headless Adaptive Form : Getting Started
post.content:
# Start Local AEM Author Instance

Follow the instructions mentioned in the section [Set up a local development environment and initial development project](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-headless-adaptive-forms/using/setup-development-environment.html?lang=en)

> 1. Download and extract the Adobe Experience Manager as a Cloud Service SDK
> 2. [Set up an Author instance](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-learn/cloud-service/local-development-environment-set-up/aem-runtime.html?lang=en#set-up-local-aem-author-service). When launching the SDK Quickstart, include the argument `-r prerelease`. All headless specific features are behind pre-release (Publish instance is not necessary for this lab session)
> 3. Access the local [AEM Author](http://localhost:4502) instance, and access Help > “About Adobe Experience Manager” to validate the versions. Adobe Experience Manager version should be greater than or equal to: 2022.7.8005.xxx (with a suffix – PRERELEASE), and Adobe Experience Manager Forms version greater than or equal to: 2022.07.06.02.xxx.
